item.title: Black Myth: Wukong Trophy & Achievement Guide
item.description:
Black Myth: Wukong has a plethora of trophies that players can obtain, and unlocking some of them can be extremely tricky. For players who are looking for the coveted Platinum trophy, here is what they need to know.

While Black Myth: Wukong only has about 36 trophies to unlock, a few are also tied to New Game+, so players will not be able to complete them in one playthrough. Don't forget, a lot of these trophies can be missed, as they are tied to side quests, so players will need to be wary of that. Here are all the trophies in the game and how to get them.

How To Get Every Trophy In Black Myth: Wukong

Trophy

Rarity

Description

How To Get

Final Fulfillment

Platinum

Each ordeal paves your path to what you are meant to be.

Unlocked after players get all the other trophies in the game.

Home is Behind

Bronze

The old monkey has told his tale. Onward you must go.

Unlocked as part of the main story.

A Spark of Thought

Bronze

Nothing sparks your talents more than a spark of thought.

Unlocked after buying a skill in the skill tree. Players can obtain skill points by leveling up in Black Myth: Wukong .

Brew of Bravery

Bronze

Fresh brew in an old cask. May it stir a great task!

Unlocked after saving the Shen Monkey NPC in Chapter 1 and using the Brew menu.

Creative Concoction

Bronze

Tonics are well and good, but not to be wolfed like food!

Unlocked after players defeat Lang-Li-Guhh-Baw, obtain the Evil Repelling Medicament and give it to the Wolf to craft medicine.

Happy Harvest

Bronze

Fields kept trim leave time to skim.

Once players unlock the Zodiac Village after finishing Chen Loong's questline, players will be able to interact with him at the Zodiac Village. Players can then give him seeds and come back at a later time to harvest them. This will unlock the trophy.

Pound and Perfect

Bronze

"Through fire, armor is refined; through trials, strength is defined."

Unlocks after upgrading armor with the help of Yin Tiger NPC in Zodiac Village.

Blazing Black Wind

Bronze

Of all things to learn, you chose to play with fire?

Unlocked as part of the main story.

Temple of Taint

Bronze

Now at an end is the elder's long wait for the journeyer.

Unlocked after players complete the bell questline and defeat Elder Jinchi.

A Great Gust

Bronze

There will be more sages if their maker still engages.

Unlocked as part of the main story.

Shifting Sands

Bronze

The beetle came with drumbeats' call, and left with waves' gentle fall.

Unlocked after players complete the Drunken Pig questline and defeat Fuban.

Nifty Nonsense

Bronze

The fat monk failed, for he spoke too much.

Unlocked as part of the main story.

Behold the Betrayal

Bronze

More eyes do not see more than the mortal trifles.

Unlocked as part of the main story.

The Cockerel Crowed

Bronze

Long and short, far and near, each span has its year.

Unlocked after players defeat the Duskveil boss in Cloudnest Peak after unlocking it as part of the Venom Daoist questline.

Flaming Fury

Bronze

The golden child brought fire and smoke; when they cleared, the family broke.

Unlocked as part of the main story.

Frost and Flame

Bronze

The merging of ice and fire, swift and severe.

Unlocked by completing the Five Element quest and defeating the boss Bishui Golden-Eyed Beast.

Meet the Match

Gold

"Let go of him, and you let go of all."

Unlocked after players complete the true ending in Black Myth: Wukong .

A Duel of Destiny

Gold

Two minds' long fray leaves but one to stay.

Unlocked as part of the main story.

The Clamor of Frogs

Bronze

Six frogs, six skills—how intriguing!

Unlocked after players kill all the frogs in the game. They can be found at the following locations.

  • Baw-Li-Guhh-Lang - Snake Trail
  • Lang-Li-Guhh-Baw - Sandgate Village Entrance
  • Lang-Li-Guhh-Lang: Forest of Felicity
  • Baw-Li-Guhh-Baw - Lower Hollow
  • Baw-Lang-Lang - Cooling Slope
  • Lang-Baw-Baw - Verdant Path

The Sire and Sons

Bronze

"For what deed, must the four waters they governed roam free?"

Unlocked after players defeat all the Loong bosses. They can be found at the following locations.

  • Red Loong - Outside the Forest
  • Black Loong - Rockrest Flat
  • Cyan Loong - Turtle Island
  • Yellow Loong - Relief of the Fallen Loong

Always Accompanied

Bronze

How odd to encounter this old man at every corner!

Unlocked after players complete the Old Man questline and max out their gourd.

Urge Unfulfilled

Bronze

"With my life I'll repay the title he gave me!"

Unlocked after players complete the Horse questline.

Six Senses Secured

Gold

After all that strife and struggle, what's truly been gained?

Unlocked after players start New Game+.

Portraits Perfected

Gold

Humans, beasts, yaoguais, and the Bodhisattvas. All recorded and noted.

Unlocked after players get all journal entries of all humans, beasts, yaoguais and Bodhisattvas.

Treasure Trove

Silver

"All the four vessels now belong to me!"

Unlocked after players get all the vessels.

Master of Magic

Silver

All spells we know are derived from the same source.

Unlocked after players get all spells in the first playthrough and fight Erlang, the Sacred Divinity in New Game+

Guardian of Gear

Silver

You are fully fitted. Now, swing that staff and fight!

Unlocked as part of the main story.

A Curious Collection

Silver

Every rare wonder the world can offer, collected and kept.

Unlocked after players get all Curios.

Medicine Meal

Silver

"Here, have it, have it all."

Unlocked after players get 5 each of Celestial Jade Lotus Pill, Celestial Taiyi Pill, and Celestial Nonary Pill.

Staffs and Spears

Silver

A walking vault of arms you have become!

Unlocked after getting all weapons.

Mantled with Might

Silver

Shoes on feet, hat on head, embroidered shirt, Daoist robe—free as can be, doing as you please!

Unlocked after getting all armor pieces.

Fickle Forms

Silver

Transformations and Spirit Skills, you have mastered them all!

Unlocked after getting all spirit skills and transformation spells.

Brewer's Bounty

Silver

What to drink, how to drink, and above all, who to drink with.

Unlocked after getting all gourds, drinks, and soaks.

Page Preserver

Bronze

"All the tattered pages can now be compiled in full."

Unlocked after getting all medicine recipes.

Seeds to Sow

Bronze

Take more as fruit as your plants take root.

Unlocked after getting all seeds.

Scenic seeker

Bronze

The most marvelous places for meditation have all met your gaze.

Unlocked after finding all meditation spots.

item.title: Astro Bot: Free Big Brother! Walkthrough (All Bots, Puzzle Pieces, and Collectibles)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Free Big Brother! Portal / Secret Exit
  • Free Big Brother! Bot #1
  • Free Big Brother! Puzzle Piece #1
  • Free Big Brother! Bot #2
  • Free Big Brother! Puzzle Piece #2
  • Free Big Brother! Bot #3
  • Free Big Brother! Puzzle Piece #3
  • Free Big Brother! Bot #4
  • Free Big Brother! Bot #5
  • Free Big Brother! Bot #6
  • Free Big Brother! Bot #7

Free Big Brother! is one of the six main stages in the Serpent Starway system and becomes available once players have completed the Slo-Mo Casino stage. It features seven Bots and three Puzzle Pieces for Astro Bot players to track down, as well as a secret exit that will unlock a new Lost Galaxy stage.

Thankfully, the Free Big Brother! warp portal is incredibly easy to find, with Astro Bot players able to reach it right from the get-go. Sadly, however, the same cannot be said for some of the stage's other collectibles, with players needing to jump through a few hoops in order to find everything and 100% complete the stage.

Free Big Brother! Portal / Secret Exit

If players take a right immediately after starting the stage, they'll eventually come to a large stone structure sticking out of the water with a few platforms in front of it. To get to the Free Big Brother!​​​​​​​ warp portal, they'll need to goad the electric enemy into shocking the two lightning pads on the left and right platforms, which they can do by standing on them and then moving as soon as it begins to prepare an attack. Once both pads have been powered, the doors will open, granting access to the stage's secret exit.

Free Big Brother! Bot #1

The first Free Big Brother Bot is on a stone platform near where players first land on the beach.

Free Big Brother! Puzzle Piece #1

The stage's first Puzzle Piece is in an enclosed area to the right of the first Bot.

Free Big Brother! Bot #2

The next Bot is a cameo Bot based on the boy from The Last Guardian and can be found on the platform directly above the first Puzzle Piece. To reach it, players will need to loop around and make use of a bird carrying a rope.

Free Big Brother! Puzzle Piece #2

Players will need to break through a blue wall on their way to remove one of the giant robot's restraints. Shortly after doing so, they'll come to a blue floor with an electric enemy on it. Using Astro's jets here will break the floor, taking players to a secret area with a cable in the ground, which, when pulled, will reveal the second Free Big Brother! Puzzle Piece.

Free Big Brother! Bot #3

​​​​​​​In addition to a Puzzle Piece, there's also a blue bounce pad hidden away beneath the blue flooring which players can use to reach another hidden area. Just to be clear, this isn't the same bounce pad that players use to escape the pit after collecting the Puzzle Piece, although it is just to the right of that one a little higher up in the pit. After reaching the next area, players will need to navigate another breakable blue floor to find a bounce pad hidden away on the left side of the ledge. This will take them up to a cameo Bot, which is based on Mono from Shadow of the Colossus .

Free Big Brother! Puzzle Piece #3

After breaking the giant robot's final shackle, the sun will come out and the stage's final Puzzle Piece will appear on top of a structure on the beach.

Free Big Brother! Bot #4

Next to the final Puzzle Piece is a circular sand pit with a blue X in the middle. If players perform a spinning punch here, they'll burrow into the sand, where the fourth Free Big Brother! Bot can be found. Like the previous Free Big Brother! collectible, this one can only be found after freeing the giant robot.

Free Big Brother! Bot #5

The fifth Free Big Brother! Bot is a cameo Bot based on Wander from Shadow of the Colossus and can be found hanging off the back of the giant robot's neck.

Free Big Brother! Bot #6

As they climb to the top of the giant robot, players will eventually come to a section with blue flooring that breaks when Astro uses his boosters above it. They should intentionally break this floor, which will allow them to drop down to a shell platform on which the stage's sixth Bot can be found.

Free Big Brother! Bot #7

The last Free Big Brother! Bot can be found sitting inside a shell at the very end of the stage.

item.title: WoW: The War Within - All Sturdy Chest Locations in Delves
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Fungal Folly Sturdy Chests
  • The Spiral Weave Sturdy Chests
  • The Underkeep Sturdy Chests
  • Tak-Rethan Abyss Sturdy Chests
  • The Sinkhole Sturdy Chests
  • Nightfall Sanctum Sturdy Chests
  • Skittering Breach Sturdy Chests
  • Mycomancer Cavern Sturdy Chests
  • The Dread Pit Sturdy Chests
  • The Waterworks Sturdy Chests
  • Kriegval's Rest Sturdy Chests
  • Earthcrawl Mines Sturdy Chests

While Delves aren't on the same level of difficulty as Dungeons or Raids in World of Warcraft , there are still a rewarding endgame activity for those who prefer something that is more casual. By being flexible with group size and difficulty, you can get exactly the kind of experience that you want in a Delve.

Delves are filled with loot, and in addition to the treasure room there are a bunch of Sturdy Chests scattered across each Delve that can be looted once for valuable vendor trash or potential gear upgrades. Unlike Mislaid Curiosities, Sturdy Chests are trickier to find since they are well hidden. But if you manage to find all of them, you will get an achievement that is part of Glory of the Delver along with a title.

Some chests can only be found when certain stories are active in a Delve. If you don't see one of the chests mentioned below, you will need to try again after the next daily reset.

Fungal Folly Sturdy Chests

The first chest can be found by the edge of the water next to three large green mushrooms.

The second chest is concealed among some vegetation on the southwest edge of Fungal Folly.

The third chest is hidden behind a waterfall that is below where the second chest was.

The fourth chest can be found underwater at the northeastern edge of Fungal Folly.

The fifth and final chest in Fungal Folly can be found by walking along the narrow edge above the water where you found the fourth chest.

The Spiral Weave Sturdy Chests

The first chest can be located shortly after the start of the Delve. In the first big room, look behind the barricade.

The second chest can only be accessed when the active story in The Spiral Weave is "From the Weaver with Love". You eventually come across a long hallway where you can use the grappling hook to get up to the rafters. The chest is up here.

The third chest can be found after beating the boss but before going down into the treasure room. As you approach the drop down spot, look to the right to see a platform below with the chest on it.

After getting the third chest, look around for a rafter that you can drop down onto. The final chest for this Delve can be found there.

The Underkeep Sturdy Chests

The first chest in The Underkeep is behind a statue immediately after entering the Delve.

The second chest is only available during "Torture Victims". Between the two round rooms, there is a hallway. The chest will be against a grate that looks like a spiderweb.

The third chest can only be found during "Weaver Rescue". Just like with the second chest, the third chest is between two round rooms in a hallway. It will be in the almost exact same spot just on a different side of the map.

The final chest in The Underkeep can be found on the south wall of the room where you fight the boss.

Tak-Rethan Abyss Sturdy Chests

The first chest can be found near the start of the Delve. Before going into the water, go around to the other side to find the chest.

It's unclear if this is intended, but anything that grants water breathing will bypass the air bubble mechanic in both The Sinkhole and Tak-Rethan entirely. So any water breathing potion or a Warlock's Unending Breath spell will make it easy to explore without having to worry about your oxygen.

The second chest is resting on top of some coral shortly after you go under the water.

The third chest is hidden in a corner shortly before you arrive at the midway respawn point.

The fourth chest can be found near some seaweed just past the respawn point.

The Sinkhole Sturdy Chests

Right at the start of the Delve, there is a pool of water near the body of water that takes you further into the Delve. Dive to the bottom of the pool of water to find the first chest.

The second chest is on the edge of the first large chamber you enter once you go underwater. It will be partially concealed by some underwater vegetation.

The third chest is behind the rock wall where the respawn point is. Carefully go around the rock but be mindful of the narrow ledge, as it is very easy to fall to your death here.

The final chest can be found along the wall of the room where you fight the boss.

Nightfall Sanctum Sturdy Chests

At the start of the Delve, approach the edge of the platform and look down. The first chest can be seen sitting on top of a plant.

The second chest can be found underwater roughly in the middle of Nightfall Sanctum. This chest doesn't appear in every version of Nightfall Sanctum, but it will appear approximately at the location that is circled.

The third chest is located on the southernmost side of the map where there is what appears to be a storage room filled with boxes, rope, and cannonballs. The chest is in the middle of all that.

The fourth chest can be reached from the boat after you kill the boss. Walk along the tip of the boat and jump down onto a rock ledge where the final chest is.

Skittering Breach Sturdy Chests

The first chest can be found in a small Nerubian building shortly after the start of the Delve.

While navigating through the cavern in the Skittering Breach, look for the second chest which is up against the wall in plain sight.

On the second circular platform, there will be another small Nerubian building. Along the right, you will see a ledge you can drop down to where the third chest is.

Rather than going into the room where the treasure is at the end, go left along a path that takes you behind the building. The final chest is hiding among some ferns.

Mycomancer Cavern Sturdy Chests

The first chest can be found on the northside of Mycomancer Cavern on the ledge with all the red vegetation.

The second chest can be found underwater.

The third chest can be found up on the ledge above where you dived into the water to find the second chest. It will be right next to a small tree.

The fourth chest is on a ledge just above the water. You can reach it by dropping down on your way up toward the treasure room.

The Dread Pit Sturdy Chests

The first chest can be found in the large chamber that you enter near the entrance of the Delve. The chest is hiding behind a small rock.

The second chest is on a ledge on the east side of The Dread Pit.

On your way up towards the treasure room, there is a small alcove off to the right. The third chest is located here.

Before entering the treasure room, look to your left and walk across the narrow ledge to find the fourth chest.

The Waterworks Sturdy Chests

You can find the first chest in the first large chamber of the Delve. The chest is right next to a cart against the wall.

Further ahead in the Delve, there is a small waterfall on the west wall. The second chest can be found in the water here.

The third chest is in the hallway before the round room near the end of the Delve. It is located under some scafolding in this room.

The final chest in The Waterworks is in the boss room. It is hiding behind some rubble that blocks the mine cart tracks on the east side of the room.

Kriegval's Rest Sturdy Chests

When you enter the first large room, take a left. The first chest is near the corner of this room along the wall.

Roughly halfway through the Delve, you will come across a room with lots of scaffolding. Jump up the platforms to reach another platform that has what appears to be a Kobold's house. The chest will be to the right.

In the room before the hallway that goes up to the boss, you will find more scaffolding. The chest is in the southeast corner of this room.

As you enter the hallway that takes you to the first boss, immediately turn around once you go down a flight of stairs. There will be a Sturdy Chest here.

Earthcrawl Mines Sturdy Chests

The first chest can be found almost immediately after entering the Delve. It is hiding behind a nearby rock pillar.

When you are partway through the first tunnel, turn left to find the second chest in a small alcove.

When you enter the large chamber after the series of tunnels, you can find the third chest in a small room off to the side.

In the same large chamber where you found the third chest, head up to the second level. Look down to spot the fourth chest on some mining equipment.

The final chest of Earthcrawl Mines is in the southwest corner of the room where you fight the boss. It's partially concealed by a loaded minecart.

item.title: Destiny 2 Has Hit a New Low
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Destiny 2 has hit a new low in player count with 32,497 average monthly users on Steam.
  • Bungie's update model and recent layoffs contribute to concerns about the game's future.
  • Bungie's acquisition by Sony may signal larger projects post-Marathon, while Destiny 2 could still see growth.

Steam numbers show that Destiny 2 has hit a new low in the last 30 days with only 32,497 average players, a far cry from its peak player count. Bungie has been updating Destiny 2 for seven years, but its best days may be behind it.

Destiny 2 has gone through ups and downs over the years since it was released. With major content updates and expansions, player counts often rise, but this is contrasted by lower player counts during quieter months. Since the game follows a seasonal model unlike its predecessor, it has seen player counts remain relatively consistent since launch. Bungie laid off many of its employees earlier this year, causing some concern about the future of Destiny 2 and its upcoming game, Marathon . With the game hitting a new low in player count numbers, the studio may need to find a way to return lapsed players to the game.

The Game Post has discovered that Destiny 2 player counts have plummeted to 32,497 average Steam players this month. This is a stark contrast when compared to the Final Shape 's expansion launch when it reached an all-time high of 123,023 average monthly players. This shows a loss of 90,526 players in a community-driven game that thrives with more gamers playing it. When factoring in all the platforms Destiny 2 is on, the population sits at around 469,180 average monthly players. Steam charts also show the Witch Queen expansion drew 60,961 average monthly players, Lightfall saw 62,610, and The Final Shape hit 32,497 only three months after their release. This means that despite The Final Shape bringing in the biggest numbers of any expansion, it has seen the biggest drop in players as well.

Destiny 2 Has Declined in Average Monthly Players

Bungie has confirmed that Destiny 2 remains a multi-year journey that will continue to see support, which may indicate that these player numbers could increase in the future. Despite this, the developer has suggested that the scale and frequency of future expansions could be affected by recent layoffs. In July 2024, Bungie laid off approximately 220 employees as part of a reorganization effort due to rising development costs. Though Bungie has denied the existence of Destiny 3 , the company was acquired by Sony for $3.6 billion, which may indicate big projects beyond Marathon .

As Bungie continues to update Destiny 2 , it may see increases to the new low of 32,497 average monthly players. The game's free-to-play nature may also help bring new players to the game in future content updates which could open the door for a higher peak than 123,023 players.

item.title: Astro Bot: Bathhouse Battle Walkthrough (All Bots, Puzzle Pieces, and Collectibles)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Bathhouse Battle Bot #1
  • Bathhouse Puzzle Piece #1
  • Bathhouse Battle Bot #2
  • Bathhouse Battle Bot #3
  • Bathhouse Puzzle Piece #2
  • Bathhouse Battle Bot #4
  • Bathhouse Battle Portal / Secret Exit
  • Bathhouse Battle Bot #5
  • Bathhouse Battle Bot #6
  • Bathhouse Puzzle Piece #3
  • Bathhouse Battle Bot #7

Bathhouse Battle can be found in the Serpent Starway star system and becomes available once Astro Bot players have finished the Slo-Mo Casino stage. Those looking to fully complete it will need to find seven Bots, three Puzzle Pieces, and one Lost Galaxy warp, the latter of which is particularly well hidden.

To accomplish this, Astro Bot players will need to make use of the stage's sponge power-up, which allows Astro to become bigger, clean up messes, and extinguish flames. The latter will be important when it comes to finding the Bathhouse Battle secret exit, as it's hidden away inside a flaming chimney.

Bathhouse Battle Bot #1

The first Bathhouse Battle Bot is tied to a rock in the stage's opening area before the big water slide.

Bathhouse Puzzle Piece #1

Shortly after acquiring the sponge power-up players will see a ring of saplings to their right. Spraying these with water will cause them to grow into pink bushes, and doing this with all twelve of them will cause a Puzzle Piece to appear in the center of the ring.

Bathhouse Battle Bot #2

The stage's second Bot can be found by washing away the ink to the left of the ink-spitting enemy that's guarding the path forward.

Bathhouse Battle Bot #3

Not long after rescuing the previous Bot, players will come to an area with a green spitting enemy and some bamboo. After breaking through the bamboo, they'll see a bamboo pipe to their right. Filling this with water will allow them to cross over to a secret area, where they'll find the third Bathhouse Battle Bot just waiting to be rescued.

Bathhouse Puzzle Piece #2

In the next area, players will find an enemy spitting ink onto a Japanese-style mural. After killing the enemy, they should clear away the ink, which will reveal the stage's second Puzzle Piece.

Bathhouse Battle Bot #4

There's a green sprout on the opposite side of the area where players find the second Puzzle Piece. Spraying this with water will cause a structure to come out of the ground, on top of which players will find the next Bot.

Bathhouse Battle Portal / Secret Exit

Immediately after climbing up the pile of sponges to exit the previous area, players should load up on water and take a left towards the big red tori gate. From here, they can climb up onto a cherry blossom tree and extinguish the flames coming out of the nearby chimney. Doing so will allow them to jump inside, where they'll find the Bathhouse Battle warp portal being guarded by a screw enemy.

Bathhouse Battle Bot #5

If players go straight after climbing the sponges rather than left, they'll soon come to some platforms that they need to climb to reach the next area. If they make their way to the right here instead of going straight up, they'll find the fifth Bathhouse Battle Bot clinging to a ledge.

Bathhouse Battle Bot #6

When players arrive in the area with the wooden boxes containing sponges, they should look for a flaming platform over to their right. After extinguishing the flames, they'll find a cameo Bot based on one of the Shibito enemies from the Siren games cowering behind the platform.

Bathhouse Puzzle Piece #3

The last Bathhouse Battle Puzzle Piece is on top of one of the piles of sponges near where players find the Shibito Bot.

Bathhouse Battle Bot #7

Right after using the aforementioned sponges to reach the next area, players will find a large red circle with a flaming dog on it on the ground. If they stand on this after absorbing some water, they'll fall through to a secret area. Here, they'll need to spray water to clear a path, which will eventually lead them to a cameo Bot based on Kutaro from an old PS3-exclusive game called Puppeteer .
